definition: to pass/to spend (time)/measure/limit/extent/degree of intensity/degree (angles, temperature etc)/kilowatt-hour/classifier for events and occurrences
to regard as/to figure/to calculate/to compute

sentences.english: Proposals were to establish a sliding scale of fess, based on the annual budget of associations.
sentences.chinese: 会议提议，基于协会的年度预算而建立一套会费机制。

sentences.english: Budgets are prepared under the directions of a company's controller on an annual basis.
sentences.chinese: 由公司主计长指导编制的年度预算。

sentences.english: Your budget figures were spot-on this year .
sentences.chinese: 你做的本年度预算数字十分准确。

sentences.english: That is more than 15 times the annual budget of the BBC World Service.
sentences.chinese: 这一数目是BBC世界广播年度预算的15倍还多。

sentences.english: Annual government budgets that are deeply in the red. The U.
sentences.chinese: 政府的年度预算已经深深地陷入红色海洋。

definition: final account/to calculate the final bill/fig. to draw up plans to deal with sth
financial year/fiscal year (e.g. from April to March, for tax purposes)
transfer payment (payment from government or private sector for which no good or service is required in return)
expenditures/expenses/CL:筆|笔[bi3], 項|项[xiang4]/to spend money/(coll.) to pay wages
